children.name: Objectives
children.comment: What are the objectives of this effort?  Examples: Beamform to increase SNR for detection. Detect every click of a rare species. Verify data quality.

children.name: Method
children.comment: High-level description of the method used

children.name: Data Source Type
children.comment: Indicates the deployment or ensemble from which the process (e.g detector) derived information

children.name: Ensemble Name
children.comment: Name of a group of instruments being used together for a common purpose (e.g. large aperture array).  The Name will correspond to an instance in the Ensemble collection.

children.name: Sequence
children.comment: Information that identifies a specific deployment within the Deployment collection.

children.name: Method
children.comment: Text based description of algorithm or citation

children.name: Software
children.comment: Name of software that implements the algorithm.  This might be the name of a plug-in or extension module that is part of a larger program or system.

children.name: Parameters
children.comment: Structured tags to describe parameters used in algorithm execution.

children.name: Support Software
children.comment: Software required in addition to the algorithm itself, e.g. Matlab, Ishmael, XBAT, Triton, etc.

children.name: Parameters
children.comment: Structured tags to describe parameters used in algorithm execution.

children.name: Objectives
children.comment: What are the objectives of this effort?  Examples: Beamform to increase SNR for detection. Detect every click of a rare species. Verify data quality.

children.name: Method
children.comment: High-level description of the method used.

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Contact Group
children.comment: Contains a subset of the OpenGIS SensorML ContactGroup (http: //www.opengis.net/sensorML/1.0).  Parsing the full SensorML schema will slow down processing.

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Altitude_m
children.comment: Optional altitude (negative for depth) in meters

children.name: SpeciesID Type
children.comment: Integrated Taxonomic Information System species identifier http://www.itis.gov/ for positive numbers.Negative numbers are interpreted by collection('phenomena').

children.name: Event Type
children.comment: Event identifier.  Optional tag typically in ISO datetime format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ identifying this event uniquely within the stream (detections, localizations, etc.).For human analysts,it is typical to use the time at which the detection was made.When used, the combination of the event and attributes that uniquely identify the set of detections(or document name) must be unique.

children.name: MetaData Info
children.comment: Information about who is responsible for this metadata record, when it was created, and how often it is updated.

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Project
children.comment: Name of project associated with this deployment.  Can be related to a geographic region, funding source, etc.

children.name: DeploymentID
children.comment: Deployment identifier, a number related to either the Nth deployment operation in a series of deployments or the Nth deployment at a specific site.

children.name: Choice
children.comment: Deployment must be associated with a site or a cruise

children.name: Site Aliases
children.comment: Alternative names for the deployment location

children.name: Platform
children.comment: On what platform is the instrument deployed? (e.g. mooring, tag)

children.name: Type
children.comment: Instrument type, e.g. HARP, EAR, Popup, DMON, etc.

children.name: Sampling Details
children.comment: Information about recordings on each channel. Sample rate, quantization bits, etc.

children.name: Channel Number
children.comment: Channels and sensors are bound together from Start to End.  While not enforced, we assume channels are numbered from 1 to N.

children.name: Sensor Number
children.comment: Audio sensor index within Sensors element

children.name: Sampling
children.comment: Sampling rate and quantization may change over time

children.name: Regimen
children.comment: Sampling regimen may change over time.  Each entry shows the start of a sampling configuration.

children.name: Gain
children.comment: Initial gain setting (assumed 0 if not populated) and any subsequent changes.

children.name: Gain_rel
children.comment: Only used if gain is not calibrated.  Relative gain may be a number on a dial.

children.name: Duty Cycle
children.comment: Duty cycle is represented by the recording duration and the interval from the start of one recording session to the next.  A duration of 3 m and an interval of 5 m would represent a 60% duty cycle, 3 m on, 2 m off.

children.name: Regimen
children.comment: Duty cycling regimen may change over time.  Each entry shows the start of a duty cycle configuration.  The abscence of entries indicates continuous sampling as would having equal values in RecordingDuration_m and RecordingInterval_m.

children.name: Objectives
children.comment: What are the objectives of this effort?  Examples: Beamform to increase SNR for detection. Detect every click of a rare species. Verify data quality.

children.name: Method
children.comment: High-level description of the method used

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115

children.name: Quality
children.comment: If no quality assurance, create an entry of Category unverified spanning the acoustic record.

children.name: Frequency Range
children.comment: QA metric applies to what frequency range?

children.name: Data
children.comment: Data from instrument, a URI is provided when not present (typical for audio).

children.name: URI
children.comment: Uniform Resource Indicator point to audio content.

children.name: Processed
children.comment: Pointer to location of data that has been processed (e.g. checked for quality, decimated, etc.)

children.name: Raw
children.comment: Pointer to raw data from the instrument.

children.name: Track
children.comment: A set of measurements about a ship/instrument's track line.

children.name: Points
children.comment: A set of sorted (by time) points associated with one or more tracklines.

children.name: Trackline
children.comment: Optional trackline number.If unimportant,everything can be put in one Points element.

children.name: Point
children.comment: Timestamped measurements:  long/lat, bearing, etc. Points should be sorted by timestamp.

children.name: Bearing DegN
children.comment: Bearing in degrees [0, 360) relative to true or magnetic north (as specified by north attribute, default magnetic)

children.name: Track Effort
children.comment: Not all measurements are associated with an instrument/ship's planned trackline (e.g. when in chase mode or transiting between tracklines).  Specify times for track effort here if needed.

children.name: Time Stamp
children.comment: Time at which instrument was deployed/recovered.Lost instruments: set recovery time to deployment time.

children.name: Audio Time Stamp
children.comment: Recording start or end - May differ from deployment time.

children.name: Contact Group
children.comment: Contains a subset of the OpenGIS SensorML ContactGroup (http: //www.opengis.net/sensorML/1.0).  Parsing the full SensorML schema will slow down processing.

children.name: Online Resource
children.comment: We do not fully conform to the onlineResources of ISO 19115
